column4: is there a GRUB channel? I really need to try to get this fixed before tomorrow
Well, I installed Ubuntu EEE from a USB stick...but to boot the OS on the hard drive, I have to boot from the usb stick
do you have grub on the MBR of the hard drive?
I assume so, grub loads, but just says no file found when I load the default kernel.
it gives you sda and sdb etc, which arent references in the menu.lst, in menu.lst, its numerated  hd0,0 hd 0,1 its weird I know, what is the reference to the / drive when you df 0-h T
ok, that looks like in grub should try to be loading a kernal image at 1,1 then
did you use an online guide to do you install?
Yeah, but it didn't consist of much. Download the iso, use a program to load it onto the usb stick and make it bootable, then boot from usb stick and install.
straight from the ubuntu eee wiki :D
ok, thanks for the help, I'll go give it a shot.
